reviewText: Pretty much a standard WWII story. Most of the actors did ok, but could have used better direction/writing as some of the scenes were somewhat amateurish.  Really good extra features. Overall, worth watching.
summary: Average movie with a bit too much CG
Title: Fortress

reviewText: A great story of the brave young American fliers of the second world war, in all a wonderful story and excellent viewing
Title: Fortress

reviewText: We usually think of the B-17 as the 8th Air Force strategic bomber that struck Germany from Britain in 1943-45 as depicted in Twelve O'Clock High and similar movies.This film shows us a different and previously neglected look at the campaign in north Africa in 1943 against Axis targets in the Mediteranean theater, It is also different in showing ethnic tensions between members of a combat crew instead of the usual idealised image of a melting pot of every American economic, regional, religious and immigrant stock. The B-17s themselves are computer generated but the generation is for once done so well that it is sometimes possible to forget that it is being done. It is not the same as actually watching historic combat footage or a survivor B-17 that can actually fly. But it was a pleasant surprise to view this movie. Recommended.
summary: Computer Generated B-17s Are Better Than No B-17s At All
Title: Fortress

reviewText: Considering this wasn't a huge Hollywood production I was impressed with this movie. Good story (although a bit predictable), good characters, good action scenes.The CGI was acceptable & the battle scenes were exciting & realistic. Sure you could probably find some mistakes in regards to the authenticity of the uniforms & equipment, but the filmmakers made a good effort at realism on their limited budget. I really enjoyed this movie.

Title: Fortress

reviewText: Let me begin by saying that it would have been a real pleasure to be able to give this film a rating of either four or five stars. Unfortunately, I think it's important to give an honest review of this type of film which involves both military and aviation history as well as film making.This is a military aviation history drama that makes extensive use of Computer Generated Imaging. CGI particularly lends itself to this genre due to the prohibitive costs involved in using actual equipment, either original or replicas, as well as the associated costs, insurance, safety hazards, etc. That said, CGI also allows the replication of actual incidents and events that would be extraordinarily dangerous to recreate.Another factor with the cuurent technoligical development of CGI is that it still doesn't look "real". This is not a problem as long as the film makers are able to present as accurate a representation as they can of the look and feel of the events and actions, that they wish to present to a viewer who would be intersted in this type of film.While the appearance of the Boeing B-17 bomber, the "Fortress" is very well done, in most of the scenes there is a minor innaccuracy in the takeoff film sequences. The film shows the fully loaded B-17 aircraft taking off with the speed, elegance and grace of a partially loaded fighter plane of that era. In reality, the word that best describes the takeoff of the fully loaded World War Two bomber is "Labored".The depictions of the bomber stream when the bombers encounter Flak are well done. During their approach to target the bombers are attacked by enemy fighter aircraft and the film producers got the sound effcts wrong. The film depicts the sound of the bombers fifty caliber defensive fire against the fighters accurately but the attacking fire of the fighters is all wrong. The later model Messerschmitt (BF-109F) fighters shown, like all of the 109 fighters, were equipped with either fifteen or twenty millimeter cannon, one in each wing. These weapons had a slightly slower rate of fire combined with a much louder and distinctive report as each round was fired. The airmen who flew the bombers have always spoken of being able, by sound alone, to know when an enemy aircraft was firing its' armament. This type of innaccuracy could still be excused if the rest of the film was true to life in its representation.The scene that is the real "Howler" occurs in that part of the film where the enemy gunfire flashes are shown. This scene also has an interception by Americam P-40 fighter aircraft of which more later. The scene shows the Luftwaffe aircraft using their smallest (7.62/.30 caliber) nose mounted machineguns to attack the bombers. Firstly, even if a german fighter pilot was literally able to attain 100% accuracy with these weapons, after firing all of his ammunition into a B-17 and having nothing left, the bomber would have proceeded onward as if nothing had happened. It would be like a single bee trying to drop an elephant. Secondly it was a not uncommon practice for Luftwaffe pilots to tell their ground crews not to put any ammunition in the nose guns as they were considered useless in aerial combat and the weight saving was a bigger positive for the overall performance of the fighter.In the interception scene the B-17 bomber crew, under attack by five BF-109 fighters, call for help from any American fighters in the area. Help arrives in the form of two P-40 fighter aircraft which, in the film, shoot down three of the enemy aircraft and drive the other two off. The P-40 was one of the main fighter aircraft that the U.S. went to war with, having been designed and in production before the war. Due to USAAF guidelines, the P-40 operated at low altitude (below 12,000 feet); above which its performance, in all regards, rapidly fell off. As a consequence it was used either for ground attack, against bombers operating at low level or against other aircraft that had equal or inferior flight characteristics. A more important factor was the qualitative difference between the P-40 and the BF-109. The BF was superior in speed, rate of climb, ability to operate at higher altitudes and firepower. In this latter case the P-40, being equipped with six .50 caliber machineguns had to get in closer in order to be able to hit the enemy aircraft while the BF-109 could stand off and fire at greater ranges due to its cannon armament. The P-40 was equal to the BF-109 in dive and superior to it in turns. In the real life situation depicted in the film the P-40s would have attempted to draw off the BF fighters using a series of feints and mock attacks, assuming the American pilots had some experience and training. Unless American pilots flying P-40s  had an overwhelming advantage in numbers at favorable altitude they would not have tangled with the Messerschmitts. Why the film makers did not depict the use of the P-51B or even P-47 as American fighters, which would have been more accurate and believable for this scene, escapes me.Overall this is a watchable film that suffers mostly from lack of research by the film makers.Correction to this review. In this review I call the B-17 a medium bomber. This is incorrect. It was originally envisaged as a bomber to replace the B-10 which was being recognized as a medium bomber due to aircraft development of that era. During the initial design stage it was decided to create a heavy bomber design rather than another medium bomber. The B-17 was the result of that process.I apologize for the error.

reviewText: but the CG is straight out of a computer game and not very believable.  and the blood is obviously poster paint/
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I normally prefer to review the disc release and not the movie but, obviously, this disc is not yet available and the movie is enough of an unknown quantity (evidenced by this being the first review) that it seemed an exception was due this time.I came across FORTRESS by accident.  I had not seen any publicity for it and I follow movie releases fairly closely. It is apparently a low budget, independent production.  It is pretty ambitious for such a film.  To recreate the large bomber formations, fighter plane attacks and even the base camp it uses a lot of CGI.So, I have seen FORTRESS and I very much enjoyed it.  Sure, the visual effects are sometimes a bit crude, but most of the time they are pretty effective and certainly good enough to support the story.  I'd say the visual effects are a bit better than those in the TV series DOGFIGHTS (which were pretty good) but not up to the standards of RED TAILS (a high bar, IMO).  The movie was well written and I was impressed by the performances by the unknown (to me) cast.  For a movie made on a tiny fraction of most big studio movie budgets it is quite an accomplishment.Synopses of the story can be found on IMDb and if you haven't watched the trailer on YouTube, yet, do so.  If you like WW II movies, especially about the air war in Europe, I think you will like FORTRESS.I like this movie enough that I have pre-ordered the Blu-ray.  Since Amazon does not mention whether or not it will have any extras, I emailed the production company and asked.  They replied that it will have a timelapse of part of the plane being built and a short documentary.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: This is a "B" movie in budget only.THAT means the actors are "unknown" and the effects are not up to the standards of a Summer Blockbuster with big name stars.The story and acting is good...and so are the effects when budget is kept in mind.The beginning of the movie shows a B-17 during a bombing mission. Disaster strikes...but it is only a glimpse of what the future of the war has in mind for the young men that crew the "Lucky Lass".Tears and laughter kind of live in the same bed during a war. Tempers and lives are quick to come and go.Fortress is a glimpse into the World of the young men of the USAAF. Attrition was about 2%...and a guy had to fly 25 missions before he could go home. That meant that your life was literally a coin toss.....50%...the odds of you living (or dying) were 50%.Is a very good movie in its own right.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: As a WWII movie buff, I was anxious to see this.  The filming was good, and the story line was fine, but the acting was really poor.  It ruined the movie for me and most of the time, I was just annoyed at the sub par performances of the actors.  I know some reviewers liked it but, personally I think Memphis Belle was a MUCH better film!  If the fact that the acting is not convincing doesn't really bother you, you might like it, but if it does, it'll irritate the heck out of you and ruin it, like it did for me.  That's my story and I'm stickin' to it!
Title: Fortress

reviewText: FORTRESS does for bomber crews whatSaving Private Ryanand a score of others did for the infantry and whatDas Boot - The Director's CutandU-571did for submariners. Aerial combat is perhaps the most easily glamorized aspect of warfare, and this film effectively shows just how "glamorous" it was to be a crew member on a WWII bomber.Many of the scenes shot inside the B-17 hark back to the days ofMidway; i.e., the plane is obviously not actually flying. Still, the outside shots of the bombing missions and duels with German fighters are quite arresting in places, usually without the animation being too obvious.We're convincingly shown a great many technical details of WWII bomber flying here, and the way FORTRESS combines the gritty realism of today's war films with some of the endearingly corny plot elements of older films works quite well.The biggest weakness is that the central characters are rather flat and under-developed. Admittedly, it would be hard to reveal the personalities of all 10 crew members in any detail without becoming ponderous, but something more in the way of human interest would help here.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I love the fact that a movie showcasing a bomber crew was made, however without a huge budget, movies like these just won't work. The movie made due with what budget it had, and presumably got the best actors they could. However, no matter what, it just fell short.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: This is an excellent  story of a flight crew of the B-17 group in Africa prior to Rommel running them out back to England.  It shows a wide range of emotions, an excellent story line although there is some corney parts, none the less it shows some of the reality of the events typical of the flight crews.  I liked it and was willing to overlook some of the silly parts and would still rate it as excellent and if the reader has any interest in The US Army Air Force (USAAF), this is well worth buying.  I would rate this as good as Memphis Bell or 12 O'Clock High.
summary: This is a very good story of comradship amougst flight crews.
Title: Fortress

reviewerName: Had to buy 2 IPads to get 1 "MonsterMXRT"

I have since plugged my Blu Ray player and Roku into the router, via CAT 5 cable and am very pleased with this video and the performance of my video equipment. reviewText: I REALLY LIKE THIS MOVIE VERY MUCH. I AM INTO HISTORICAL AND WAR MOVIES A LOT. THIS MOVIE SHOWS HOW OUR MILITARY HAVE TO GO THROUGH.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: This WWII film about B-17 crews based in North Africa bombing Italian targets is ambitious for its task.  The story involves a restrained and modest green replacement pilot becoming accepted by his savvy hard-drinking veteran crew.  The human story is done well, albeit with a few cliched stock characters.  There is of course heavy reliance on CG's and a B-17 actually does a loop (possible?).  Considering its an independent production, I give them "A" for effort but a "C+" for results compared to "Memphis Belle" or "12 O'clock High". It's worth seeing.
summary: OK considering the massive story line
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I really thought this might be a good movie.  Having seen "Memphis Belle" several times, I bought this without seeing any trailers.  I will NOT do that again!!!  If I'd seen the trailer, I might have rented it, but definitely NOT bought it.  Acting was so-so and the worse part was the computer generated B-17's.  The bomber just looked all wrong, especially the waist gunner openings (too large), too short nose.  In one scene, the B-17 is landing and the tail wheel is still retracted.  I also thought the ball turret had to be retracted on take off and landings.  I would say, the end of the movie, was better than the first hour or so.I would not recommend purchasing this movie and renting is, well, the better option, that way you don't blow $13.00!!!
Title: Fortress

reviewText: Nothing to write home about. If you have Memphis Belle and 12 O'Clock High in your video library, you don't need this one. Save your money.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: Very good movie.  Shows the hell of war!  The emotions of war and more!  Recommend watching this movie.  A must for WII HISTORIANS!
summary: Must see for W WII HISTORIANS!
Title: Fortress

reviewText: The saddest part of this film is the CGI.  The filmmakers obviously had no funding to do things right, so they turned this into a video game with live actors.  The actors were bad but I suspect that was more because the script was so bad.  I can't believe it got any funding at all.There are no transitions, and the conflict is absent too.  Nothing makes sense and there is no sense of impending danger despite the fact that these are pilots in the Eighth Air Force and more likely to die than soldiers landing on the beaches at Normandy.  The film is supposed to be about the bombing raids on Rome but there's no build up, nothing to foreshadow what lies ahead.The story idea is great, but it stays an idea and nothing more.  I love any and all WWII films and I usually just buy them straight off, but this time I happened to see it at Redbox and so I rented it for $1.20.  So glad I did.Save your money.  When Steven Spielberg gets around to the American bombing raid on Rome, then you can buy the DVD.  Sadly, this isn't it.
summary: A good story idea badly executed
Title: Fortress

reviewText: The fortress movie is a good movie I am a war buff and I enjoy all movies about the B-17 air plane.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I love the premise.  The execution however was pretty bad.  Some of the aerial shots with only one or two planes in frame looked pretty good but overall the effects were cheesy like you'd see well, on the history channel and the acting was truly awful.  I love b17s and wanted this to be as good if not better than The Memphis Belle which is really the only B17 movie in existence but this comes nowhere close.  I did not even watch the last 20 minutes.  Another thing that really bothered me was that the waist gunners 50 cals were blatantly dummy guns.  They didn't even have charging handles!!!  I suspect because the movie was so low budget they couldn't hire a hollywood armorer or some guy with a class 3 license to rent them a couple of 50 cals and a a couple thousand rounds of blanks.
summary: These are the kinds of movies that you have to wonder how they get made.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: This is based on a true story. It's  a low budget flick with newbie actors and it's worth your time if you like war movies. I think most of the people who criticize this movie have never seen older movies , which had models for effects. If they had they would stop whining about the decent cgi effects in this one. But we do have a whole generation of people whose minds are rotted by video games (they expect that type of effects and constant action) so what else can you say?  It's a good enough b movie but obviously they did not have the money to make it look more real. I don't care because it's a b movie and these effects would have been top notch in 1999 etc.  it shows how far we have come. since that time that even a b movie can have cgi that looks pretty good these days. If you like war movies you should like this one.  The blu ray looks great as you would expect too.
summary: low budget flick with a good story.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: What an absolute surprise! Found this for $7.50! Always loved WWII aerial combat flicks ala John Wayne, Spencer Tracy, Robert Taylor, etc.,etc...figured that for the price I couldn't go wrong! This movie was even better than I expected. The aerial battles are spectacular and the action, intense. On the ground we have great character development happening, and the actors are believable in their roles. Bug Hall and Chris Owen are exceptional, as is Donnie Jeffcoat, Sean McGowan and Manu Intiraymi. These guys make up part of the crew of a B-17 "Flying Fortress". The CGIs were done very well and are highly believable. Anyway, the action takes place in the sky. The B-17s opperate from an airbase built in the desert in Algiers. These "birds" are sent to pummel the "Krauts" in Italy. Lt. Michael Schmidt (Bug Hall) is sent to replace "Pops" who was killed in action. He must prove himself being worthy in battle, to gain the necessary respect from his crew he needs in order to be accepted as one of the "Lucky Lass'" wayward Irish sons. Mike Phillips did a remarkable job directing, as did Jason McKinley on the aerial sequences. A fine, well rounded film loaded with action and characters that you care about. I give this flick 5 stars for doing what it should do...entertain!
summary: Terrific WWII Epic Out of Nowhere...
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I cannot understand ANY of the five-star reviews of this film unless they are all false reviews placed by friends or family members of the guys in this "movie."  As others have said, this is an extremely low budget movie and it shows - all throughout the movie, it shows!  There isn't a single real B-17 in this movie, they're all CGI animated, and the aerial sequences look worse than what you'll find in the average computer game these days.  The story line is extremely weak and jumps around, and there's just no way to sugar coat it - this movie is a complete train wreck.Even if you're a WWII aviation fanatic and a devotee of the B-17, I wouldn't waste my money on this one unless you can get it out of the $5 discount bin somewhere, and even then, it is painful to try and sit through.  Highly recommend avoiding this stinker, couldn't find anything redeeming about it.
summary: It's a video game with really bad acting.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I saw this dvd on the way out Wal-Mart it was in a ten dollar box, this movie is the by far the best air war movie I have ever seen. The actors could not act nor the story line. The planes look so real it was as you were right there with them, unbelieveable if you love air war movies this is for you. I'll watch it over and over I am sure there will be something I missed each time.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: ...well wait, if I call this movie a turkey it will put you off Thanksgiving meals for years. So lets make this simple, to wit:1) Acting-  Horrible, even given the fact that it was populatedby "c" list actors.2) Realism- Non-existant!!  The aircraft were all (very obviously)computer graphics...including the long shots of the airbase.  It was as if this was a High School productionof "Memphis Belle" using student actors and sets that wouldfit on the stage of a High School auditorium!3) Other-  The premise, i.e., an Irish crew that drinks constantly,getsroaring drunk (both officers and enlisted men together) andflies missions into Italy the next day, ispreposterous...and I haven't even mentioned the "still"where they make their own booze right under the noseof the commanding officers. I could go on and on, as wherethey take a (computer graphic) B-17 up to about 30,000 feetAfter they lose TWO engines, etc., etc.In a nutshell, this may be the 21st century's version of "Plan 9 From Outer Space"...without Bela Lugosi.P.S.  I just read some of the positive reviews written about this movie and it makes me wonder if they actually watched the movie...or if they somewhow watched a different movie than I watched!!!
Title: Fortress

reviewText: My father was a B-17G pilot in Europe and managed to survive his missions.  I have also been privileged to have taken a flight in a B-17 so needless to say, I was interested in this film.BUT, I made the mistake of watching the extras on the DVD before I watched the film.  Not that it gave the plot away, but I saw the shortcuts they had to take to make it on a limited budget.  Then I looked for flaws instead of just watching.  If you know as much as I do about B-17s and the way missions were flown, you'll pick the film apart.  It is not a big bucks movie and as the credits state, it was a labor of love.  It is not 12 O-clock High.  If it wasn't for the music and the name on the plane, you'd never know the crew was suppose to be Irish.Speaking of credits, watch the credits until the end.  It will help you to understand what they did do and couldn't do.With all of that said, it was a good film and I'm glad I watched it.  The last mission was well done and made it all worth watching.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: This movie is not a Hollywood Blockbuster....However...This smaller production company did a very good job showing what the guys went through during WWII in Europe.  A good story line with decent acting and great CGI effects (way too short) but good!!!  I first saw this trailer as a movie coming out of Germany.....was shocked to see is was done in the USA. For WWII buffs, this is a good movie to see.
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I loved this movie and recommend it to anyone interested in this type of history, there is some cinema that appears not perfect but it doesn't take away anything from the story or enjoyment, very well done!
Title: Fortress

reviewText: I bought Fortress on the recommendation of a friend, and from the very first moment I was hooked!  Starring Bug Hall, Donnie Jeffcoat, Sean McGowan, and Manu Intiraymi, this movie tells the story of a B-17 bomber crew who, after losing their original commander in a raid over Sicily, find themselves having to deal with breaking in the replacement, a young pilot who has no clue how to fit in, and who seems to do everything wrong at first, alienating the men he's supposed to be commanding.The thing I loved most about this film is the acting.  The stars bring a freshness and vitality to the story that seems to be lacking in most big-budget Hollywood war epics, and they are the best and brightest of today's crop of young actors.  I definitely hope to see more from this bunch!The story was very good as well.  Some of the pranks that the Lucky Lass's crew pulled on their new commander (and each other) brought to mind some of the stories I used to hear from my father about his service in the Navy Seabees, and I spent a good amount of time watching Fortress and being just plain awestruck at how real the Lucky Lass and her crew felt to me because of the things they would do.All in all, Fortress was a wonderful movie, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone without hesitation.
summary: Awesome movie, one I would highly recommend
Title: Fortress
